main event: Four bright white circular objects were spotted by the crew of a B-52 bomber aircraft 50 miles south of Albany, New York on March 27, 1965.
interesting points: The objects were about the size of a quarter and in a line formation, equally spaced apart.
The objects lit up the sky with their brightness and were falling in a hypersolic arc.
The objects abruptly disappeared after 3-5 seconds of observation.
The pilot initially did not see the objects, but the co-pilot had previously witnessed a rocket re-entry and said this was different.
The objects seemed close to the aircraft, and disappeared when they reached an altitude of approximately 45,000 feet.
location: 50 miles south of Albany, New York
witnesses: Crew of a B-52 bomber aircraft
